item.description:
Kaitlyn sitting on White Ledge 300 feet above Solitude Lake.

A link to photos of the trail and views at the top I took on 7-25-12.  The photo album also contains pictures and comments on how to find the trailhead  as one turns onto Mountain Road off of NH-103

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.3654148748111.2140063.1106316361&type=3&l=4cb5b5f111

Located on a shoulder of Mount Sunapee climbing the Andrew Brook Trail to Lake Solitude and White Ledge above the Lake offers a better view than the top of Mount Sunapee which is not above tree line and is cluttered with the ski area but it does offer some views where the trees were cleared for the ski area. The hike is 4.8 miles round trip with an elevation gain of 1,507 feet. Going to the ski area and back would add another 2 miles to the hike.

There is obviously more than one way to get to the trailhead this is just one way.

1. While heading up I-93 N from Manchester take the exit onto 1-89 N 20.8 mi

2.Take exit 9 for NH-103 toward Warner/Bradford 0.2 mi

3. Turn right onto NH-103 W 12.0 mi

4. Turn left onto Mountain Rd 1.2 mi

5. Park at the pull out parking area just before the bridge on the right or just     past the bridge.

This could be considered a moderate hike for some people, especially if you don't hike regularly or get some sort of regular exercise. So I wouldn't recommend this hike if you are mostly a couch potato. Although there are some level spots on the trail, it is mostly uphill all the way up to the lake and then up to the White Ledge. On the other hand, I am not in a hurry when I hike and like to enjoy the journey just as much as the destination so it won't be a race to the top either.

So everyone is covered by the liability waiver any guest you want to bring should sign up as a member to come on the hike. Minors would need a waiver signed by a parent/guardian.

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: The parking lot for the trail head is where the right guardrail starts just before the 3rd bridge which is in between 236 Mountain Road and 276 Mountain Road. The trailhead has an obvious pull out for parking and is 1.2 miles up Mountain Road.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Lake Solitude and White Ledge, Mt. Sunapee - 4.8 Miles 1507 Ft Elev. Gain Moder.
